item.title: Dumped Item, 26th July
item.description:
On Brantwood Way at the junction with Main Road, St Mary Cray, Orpington: Please could you remove a dumped fridge from the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brantwood Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trip Hazard Outside My Property – Urgent Request for Repair, 26th July
item.description:
There is a section of raised or uneven concrete at the boundary between the public footpath and my front entrance (just outside the gate of 12 Cromwell Road). This concrete strip runs continuously along the base of the front garden walls of neighbouring properties as well, so it appears to be part of the original pavement design and likely under council maintenance. My children have tripped over this area multiple times recently, especially in the evenings when visibility is lower. It poses a clear trip hazard and could potentially cause injury. I urge the council to assess and take action to make the area safe as soon as possible. Photos available on request.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cromwell Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal Advertising Poster, 26th July
item.description:
Second report regarding the same issue: On Geddes Place at the junction with Arnsberg Way, Bexleyheath - outside Geddes Place United Reformed Church - please ask your contractor to return to remove the poster properly from a green street cabinet on the pavement. See picture attached of the poor job the contractor did last week in an attempt to remove the poster from the cabinet.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Geddes Place, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Teenagers Catapulting, 26th July
item.description:
I was walking my dogs around 10pm in Grassmead recreation ground and in the distance could hear people and see torches being shone and then a loud bang of their catapults! It was purposely shot our way. They was also shining the torches into the bushes and trees looking for animals to harm. The matter has been reported to the police but they'll be long gone before they arrive! I've had too many encounters with these horrible kids now. I am petrified to walk my dogs any time of the day, something seriously needs to be done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanton Close, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ion hole, 26th July
item.description:
There is an iron hole on the floor outside Williams toy shop.Beckham high street is considered very dangerous on the markings.There are not enough. This caused inconvenience as my mother fell to the ground with my daughter , who is four years old and damaged herself. We also have other witnesses and saw it happen. This could really cause a big problem to someone who is even more frail

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coopers Mews, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car abandoned, 26th July
item.description:
This car has been abandoned for weeks in Foxhole Road. It is covered in birds poo and is just an eyesore. Also the road around it needs a good clean; there are broken bottles, etc. I hope you can just take it away as it will encourage others to dump cars there, if the car is not collected soon.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foxhole Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Accident Hotspot, 26th July
item.description:
A few parking spots up to the bin need to be removed and replaced with double yellow lines. Currently there is a pinch point and I have witnessed multiple car accidents due to the pinch point it creates, causing vehicles to run into the kerb on one side, or into parked vehicles on the other, especially at busy times it also causes traffic jams in one direction.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169, Sumner Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
